thread.title: danjmartin published North West Leicestershire general election 2017 result

author: danjmartin
title: danjmartin published North West Leicestershire general election 2017 result
text:
North West Leicestershire general election 2017 result By danjmartin | Posted: June 09, 2017 0 COMMENTS SHARES North West Leicestershire general election 2017 result X 
Copy link to paste in your message / 
So the first result of the election in Leicestershire is in and Conservative Andrew Bridgen has held North West Leicestershire. 
The pro-Brexit Tory has been returned to Westminster with an increased majority of 13,286. 
Mr Bridgen won 31,153 votes to keep Labour rival county councillor Sean Sheahan in second place. 
Coun Sheahan recorded 17,867 votes. 
General election 2017: Updates throughout the night as Leicestershire goes to the polls 
The Liberal Democrat candidate Michael Wyatt was unusual in that he had campaigned for leave in last year's EU referendum against his party's policy. 
However it did not prevent him being well beaten into third place. He secured 3,420 votes which placed him ahead of Green candidate Mia Woolley got 1,101 votes. 
The turnout was a high 71.27 per cent How North West Leicestershire voted in 2017 Andrew BRIDGEN - Conservative: 31,153
